meanings.definition: Catch in or as in a trap
meanings.sent1: The spider quickly ensnares its prey in its web.
meanings.sent2: The hunter set up a trap to ensnare the elusive rabbit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat ensnares the toy mouse in a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: Her captivating smile ensnares the hearts of many admirers.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody of the music ensnares the audience in its spell.

meanings.definition: To involve in difficulties or complications
meanings.sent1: The dishonest scheme ensnares unsuspecting victims in financial trouble.
meanings.sent2: Carelessness can easily ensnare you in a web of mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The tangled wires ensnare the clumsy puppy in a comical mess.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination often ensnares students in a cycle of stress and deadlines.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plot of the mystery novel ensnares readers in suspense until the very end.
